title: Under the Lights
body:
Pairing: Chris Evans x reader

Warning: Fluff

A/N: this fic was written for @chantelle-x0x song challenge! Thank you so much for letting me participate in it. I really loved the idea and hope you like this one 💕 Since it’s a song challenge, my story is based on I See the Light from Tangled.

I know the due date is September, but I got so excited that I couldn’t not write it asap. C'mon, it’s Disney! (I was dying to write something, but had no ideas for the other fics I wanna write).

I’d like to apologise in advance if it’s a little bit too philosophical, but I really couldn’t help myself. I like this kind of thing 😊

Late Summer

It was a warm and lovely night. You were sitting on one of the chairs around the table the Evans had in their back deck, admiring the starry sky and lost in thoughts.

“Ma?”, you heard a familiar voice calling from inside and his footsteps growing louder. When he saw there was someone in the deck, he went to check. “Y/N? Hi! Have you seen my mom?”, Chris asked.

“She went out to have dinner with Shanna.  She said she’d probably be back in two hours from now”.

“Alright. Thanks”, he furrowed his brows studying the scene before his eyes. “What are you doing here alone?”

“Just thinking”.

“Care if I join you?”

“I don’t as long as you don’t come empty-handed”, you smirked at him making him laugh.

“Say no more”, he exclaimed and got inside the house.

You’ve come to Boston for a period of internship. Not so long after your arrival, you met Chris Evans at a friend’s party and the connection was almost instant. You two became good friends and eventually you befriended his family as well, at the point of spending some weekends in his mother’s house to keep her company at night since all her children had their own places by now. This weekend was one of those.

“Why you didn’t go to Shanna’s with my mom?”, Chris had returned to the deck.

“Something in your sister said that she needed some time alone with her mother so I prefered to stay. And to be honest I was not in the mood to go out”, you replied right before your eyes landed on what Chris had in his hand. “Wine? You’re evolving Evans”, you teased him making him chuckle.

“Who could ever say that I am a Pokémon, right?”

You couldn’t help, but laugh at that not so funny joke of Chris. “That explains a lot. Considering how stubborn you are, I’d say you’re a Pikachu.”

“Hilarious”, he tried not to laugh.

Chris sat on a chair across the table and filled your glasses with the sweet red wine he had brought. Having sipped your drinks, you two remained silent for some minutes until Chris noticed that only your body was present there, your mind was travelling far away.

“What is it?”, he asked calling you back to Earth.

“Nothing, it’s just some things I’ve been feeling since I arrived in Boston.”

“Wanna talk about it?

“I don’t know if you or another person would believe it or at least understand it”, you toyed sofly with you glass while looking at the stars.

“Listen, it doesn’t matter if I believe it or not. If it’s important to you, it’s important to me as well so I’ll do my best to try to understand whatever it is”, Chris said after placing his hand on your knee to catch your full attention.

“Thank you”, was all you said before smiling at him and placing you hand on his. Knowing you’d start opening up, both of you positioned yourselves confortably on the chairs. Taking a sip of wine from your glass, you began.

“Actually I always felt this, but since I came here it intensified. I feel like someone, maybe God, is trying to tell me something about where I belong, y'know? Cuz I never felt like I really belonged anywhere and that’s why I love travelling. Every place I go I feel at home for a short period of time and it’s worth it. To be honest, I love that about myself”, you stopped talking for a bit in order to organize your line of thoughts and Chris waited patiently.

“However”, you continued, “something is different now, here, in Boston. What I feel about the city is the same I did about other ones, but… I don’t know”, you were getting passionate while expressing what you had been keeping to yourself for so long. “It’s like I’m watching my life through a window imagining what comes next and being all excited about whatever it is ‘cause I know it’s good. Does it make any sense?”

“It does”, Chris answered before being silent for some seconds as if he was pondering about what to say. “What you just described is very similar to what I’ve been feeling for almost a year. Of course in my case I don’t think it has anything to do with cities ‘cause I love Boston, it’s my home. But I feel like I live constantly on the verge of something new and great. Like all was gonna be answered soon, but 'soon’ never comes”.

He paused and looked at you, empathy in his eyes just like the same you knew you were showing him. Recognizing in his eyes the familiar will of wanting to put everything in your head aside, you just looked at the bottom of your almost empty glass and joked.

“Wow, what you guys put in this one? I’ve never got too philosophical after only two glasses as I do with the wine you serve here”.

Chris threw his head back and laughed out loud, his hand on his left boob. “Well, it’s like a secret family recipe. I’d have to kill you if I told you”, he managed to say making you laugh as much as him. Obviously, alcohol had worked its way.

You and Chris spent the rest of the night talking about silly things until Lisa finally came back home. Feeling tired, you hugged her and Chris excusing yourself and headed to Scott’s room, where you used to sleep while staying with Lisa. Crashing on the matress, you fell asleep instantly.

_______________

Late November

“Hey, what are you up to?”, Chris asked on the other side of the phone.

“Nothing much, just grading some papers”.

“Nice. Will you be busy in the evening today?”

“I haven’t planned anything yet. Why you asking?”

“Cuz since this year’s will be your first Christmas in Boston I wanted to take you to our typical Faneuil Hall Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony. What do you say?”

“Ohhh I’d love that! I like Christmas lights in general so I say yes”, you replied excitedly and Chris laughed at your reaction.

“Alright. I’ll pick you up at 7 p.m., okay?”

“Sure! I’ll be waiting”, you hung up after you both had said your see ya’s.

Chris and you were closer than ever and because of that a lot of people thought you were more than friends, which was clearly not true. To be honest, you were not sure about what you felt for him. You loved the guy, but you didn’t know if you did it as a friend or something else. Sometimes it seemed like you were dating 'cause you’d do things that only couples do except for the physical/sexual part. When asked about why you did those things, you both answered that it was just a good and strong friendship, which explained why you felt so confortable around each other and, consequently, why you acted (according to some people) in such an intimate way toward one another.

Chris picked you up at 7 p.m. on the dot and drove you both to Faneuil Hall Marketplace. The square was already crowded so Chris, being the taller one, led you through the sea of people. He finally found a good spot not too close or too far from the tree and then he told you to plant yourself in front of him so you could see everything better. You only had to wait some minutes before the audience started counting down. You and Chris followed and cheered when the lights were on and the tree was completely illuminated. Therefore, the show began and everything was colorful as the tree’s colors changed while 'All I Want For Christmas Is You’ played.

At the peak of your excitement, you turned your head to face Chris and grinned at him. However, the way he looked at you warmed your heart for some reason. What you didn’t know is that it was different 'cause at that exact moment something had clicked with Chris’s own heart. Seeing you grinning at him and the giant bright tree in the background projecting a kind of halo around your face made Chris finally understand what the great thing he always felt like on the verge of was. You were different from all the other women he had dated before and deep in his soul he always felt that somehow you would be forever in his life. He knew he loved you, but just like you he wasn’t sure how. Now, there was no more doubts for him.

Your eyes were locked and none of you could break what seemed to be a spell only you two were under. Soon something started clicking with you too. It was like all the fog before your eyes has lifted and everything was so clear. There was no noise in your brain, all the doubts and questions were gone and finally you knew you were where you were meant to be. It’s never been about belonging to a place and at that moment you understood that. It was like all the small and bright trees around you were pointing to Chris, like a natural compass pointing to your personal North. All at once everything looked different now that you were seeing that man standing in front of you, whose lips were slightly apart as if something was sinking in.

Apparently you both haven’t seen the time pass, but another song was playing now: 'Hallelujah’ by Händel. The song’s strong chords seemed to break the spell you two were under and all you could do was walk towards each other closing the distance between you. With your arms around Chris’s neck, and his around your waist, you smiled and giggled at one another. No words were necessary 'cause your eyes and hearts were speaking a language only you could comprehend.

“And the 'soon’ I was waiting for came in an unexpected way”, Chris said softly touching your foreheads.

“And in an unexpected way I finally found out where my heart belongs to”.

Chris’s smile widened and he gave you a gentle peck on the nose right before pressing his lips passionately against yours.

(Credits to Robert Kearns’s channel on Youtube. This was my favorite video of the event)

———

Tag List:

@whiskey-cokenfanfic @thinkxlovexloud @gabriellewritermua @mackevanstanfan80 @thegetawaywriter @jbug491 @patzammit @katiew1973 @princess-evans-addict @humandasaster @mrs-captain-evans @feelmyroarrrr @coffeebooksandfandom @ivvitm1109 @queenof-wakanda @socie @xxloki81xx @jaqui-has-a-conspiracy-theory @hazellnut94 @bookgirlunicorn @captains-my-captains @ynm1505 @troublermalik @asgardians-of-wakanda @chrisevansfanfic

(If you’d like to be added to or removed from my list, just let me know)

The song’s strong chords seemed to break the spell you two were under and all you could do was walk towards each other closing the distance between you. With your arms around Chris’s neck, and his around your waist, you smiled and giggled at one another. No words were necessary 'cause your eyes and hearts were speaking a language only you could comprehend.

“And the 'soon’ I was waiting for came in an unexpected way”, Chris said softly touching your foreheads.

“And in an unexpected way I finally found out where my heart belongs to”.

Chris’s smile widened and he gave you a gentle peck on the nose right before pressing his lips passionately against yours.

(Credits to Robert Kearns’s channel on Youtube. This was my favorite video of the event)

trail.content:
Pairing: Chris Evans x reader

Warning: Fluff

A/N: this fic was written for @chantelle-x0x song challenge! Thank you so much for letting me participate in it. I really loved the idea and hope you like this one 💕 Since it’s a song challenge, my story is based on I See the Light from Tangled.

I know the due date is September, but I got so excited that I couldn’t not write it asap. C'mon, it’s Disney! (I was dying to write something, but had no ideas for the other fics I wanna write).

I’d like to apologise in advance if it’s a little bit too philosophical, but I really couldn’t help myself. I like this kind of thing 😊

Late Summer

It was a warm and lovely night. You were sitting on one of the chairs around the table the Evans had in their back deck, admiring the starry sky and lost in thoughts.

“Ma?”, you heard a familiar voice calling from inside and his footsteps growing louder. When he saw there was someone in the deck, he went to check. “Y/N? Hi! Have you seen my mom?”, Chris asked.

“She went out to have dinner with Shanna.  She said she’d probably be back in two hours from now”.

“Alright. Thanks”, he furrowed his brows studying the scene before his eyes. “What are you doing here alone?”

“Just thinking”.

“Care if I join you?”

“I don’t as long as you don’t come empty-handed”, you smirked at him making him laugh.

“Say no more”, he exclaimed and got inside the house.

You’ve come to Boston for a period of internship. Not so long after your arrival, you met Chris Evans at a friend’s party and the connection was almost instant. You two became good friends and eventually you befriended his family as well, at the point of spending some weekends in his mother’s house to keep her company at night since all her children had their own places by now. This weekend was one of those.

“Why you didn’t go to Shanna’s with my mom?”, Chris had returned to the deck.

“Something in your sister said that she needed some time alone with her mother so I prefered to stay. And to be honest I was not in the mood to go out”, you replied right before your eyes landed on what Chris had in his hand. “Wine? You’re evolving Evans”, you teased him making him chuckle.

“Who could ever say that I am a Pokémon, right?”

You couldn’t help, but laugh at that not so funny joke of Chris. “That explains a lot. Considering how stubborn you are, I’d say you’re a Pikachu.”

“Hilarious”, he tried not to laugh.

Chris sat on a chair across the table and filled your glasses with the sweet red wine he had brought. Having sipped your drinks, you two remained silent for some minutes until Chris noticed that only your body was present there, your mind was travelling far away.

“What is it?”, he asked calling you back to Earth.

“Nothing, it’s just some things I’ve been feeling since I arrived in Boston.”

“Wanna talk about it?

“I don’t know if you or another person would believe it or at least understand it”, you toyed sofly with you glass while looking at the stars.

“Listen, it doesn’t matter if I believe it or not. If it’s important to you, it’s important to me as well so I’ll do my best to try to understand whatever it is”, Chris said after placing his hand on your knee to catch your full attention.

“Thank you”, was all you said before smiling at him and placing you hand on his. Knowing you’d start opening up, both of you positioned yourselves confortably on the chairs. Taking a sip of wine from your glass, you began.

“Actually I always felt this, but since I came here it intensified. I feel like someone, maybe God, is trying to tell me something about where I belong, y'know? Cuz I never felt like I really belonged anywhere and that’s why I love travelling. Every place I go I feel at home for a short period of time and it’s worth it. To be honest, I love that about myself”, you stopped talking for a bit in order to organize your line of thoughts and Chris waited patiently.

“However”, you continued, “something is different now, here, in Boston. What I feel about the city is the same I did about other ones, but… I don’t know”, you were getting passionate while expressing what you had been keeping to yourself for so long. “It’s like I’m watching my life through a window imagining what comes next and being all excited about whatever it is ‘cause I know it’s good. Does it make any sense?”

“It does”, Chris answered before being silent for some seconds as if he was pondering about what to say. “What you just described is very similar to what I’ve been feeling for almost a year. Of course in my case I don’t think it has anything to do with cities ‘cause I love Boston, it’s my home. But I feel like I live constantly on the verge of something new and great. Like all was gonna be answered soon, but 'soon’ never comes”.

He paused and looked at you, empathy in his eyes just like the same you knew you were showing him. Recognizing in his eyes the familiar will of wanting to put everything in your head aside, you just looked at the bottom of your almost empty glass and joked.

“Wow, what you guys put in this one? I’ve never got too philosophical after only two glasses as I do with the wine you serve here”.

Chris threw his head back and laughed out loud, his hand on his left boob. “Well, it’s like a secret family recipe. I’d have to kill you if I told you”, he managed to say making you laugh as much as him. Obviously, alcohol had worked its way.

You and Chris spent the rest of the night talking about silly things until Lisa finally came back home. Feeling tired, you hugged her and Chris excusing yourself and headed to Scott’s room, where you used to sleep while staying with Lisa. Crashing on the matress, you fell asleep instantly.

_______________

Late November

“Hey, what are you up to?”, Chris asked on the other side of the phone.

“Nothing much, just grading some papers”.

“Nice. Will you be busy in the evening today?”

“I haven’t planned anything yet. Why you asking?”

“Cuz since this year’s will be your first Christmas in Boston I wanted to take you to our typical Faneuil Hall Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony. What do you say?”

“Ohhh I’d love that! I like Christmas lights in general so I say yes”, you replied excitedly and Chris laughed at your reaction.

“Alright. I’ll pick you up at 7 p.m., okay?”

“Sure! I’ll be waiting”, you hung up after you both had said your see ya’s.

Chris and you were closer than ever and because of that a lot of people thought you were more than friends, which was clearly not true. To be honest, you were not sure about what you felt for him. You loved the guy, but you didn’t know if you did it as a friend or something else. Sometimes it seemed like you were dating 'cause you’d do things that only couples do except for the physical/sexual part. When asked about why you did those things, you both answered that it was just a good and strong friendship, which explained why you felt so confortable around each other and, consequently, why you acted (according to some people) in such an intimate way toward one another.

Chris picked you up at 7 p.m. on the dot and drove you both to Faneuil Hall Marketplace. The square was already crowded so Chris, being the taller one, led you through the sea of people. He finally found a good spot not too close or too far from the tree and then he told you to plant yourself in front of him so you could see everything better. You only had to wait some minutes before the audience started counting down. You and Chris followed and cheered when the lights were on and the tree was completely illuminated. Therefore, the show began and everything was colorful as the tree’s colors changed while 'All I Want For Christmas Is You’ played.

At the peak of your excitement, you turned your head to face Chris and grinned at him. However, the way he looked at you warmed your heart for some reason. What you didn’t know is that it was different 'cause at that exact moment something had clicked with Chris’s own heart. Seeing you grinning at him and the giant bright tree in the background projecting a kind of halo around your face made Chris finally understand what the great thing he always felt like on the verge of was. You were different from all the other women he had dated before and deep in his soul he always felt that somehow you would be forever in his life. He knew he loved you, but just like you he wasn’t sure how. Now, there was no more doubts for him.

Your eyes were locked and none of you could break what seemed to be a spell only you two were under. Soon something started clicking with you too. It was like all the fog before your eyes has lifted and everything was so clear. There was no noise in your brain, all the doubts and questions were gone and finally you knew you were where you were meant to be. It’s never been about belonging to a place and at that moment you understood that. It was like all the small and bright trees around you were pointing to Chris, like a natural compass pointing to your personal North. All at once everything looked different now that you were seeing that man standing in front of you, whose lips were slightly apart as if something was sinking in.

Apparently you both haven’t seen the time pass, but another song was playing now: 'Hallelujah’ by Händel. The song’s strong chords seemed to break the spell you two were under and all you could do was walk towards each other closing the distance between you. With your arms around Chris’s neck, and his around your waist, you smiled and giggled at one another. No words were necessary 'cause your eyes and hearts were speaking a language only you could comprehend.

“And the 'soon’ I was waiting for came in an unexpected way”, Chris said softly touching your foreheads.

“And in an unexpected way I finally found out where my heart belongs to”.

Chris’s smile widened and he gave you a gentle peck on the nose right before pressing his lips passionately against yours.

(Credits to Robert Kearns’s channel on Youtube. This was my favorite video of the event)

title: A Walk in the Park
body:
Chapter 18

Description: When your husband dies in an accident, you try to move on with your life. When the memories of your shared home become too much even after two years, you make a drastic change and move to California. A new career, a new way of life, and an attractive new friend help you move on to find the happiness you need.

Pairings: Chris Evans x Reader    

Warnings for this chapter:  A smidge of angst. Mostly fluff! A little cursing. It’s me, you should expect that by now.

A/N: THANK YOU guys so much for your love and support on this series. This originally started out as a one shot but I loved writing that it just kept going. After this chapter there are only two chapters left! Don’t forget to vote on which story you want next! Please let me know if you would like to be tagged and keep let me know what you think! Reblogs are always appreciated.

Chapter 17 pt 2

You had to wait four days before your first date with Chris. Four, long, torturous days. After your night in the park, he had to work the next two days on re-recording some audio for a movie he had filmed a few months back. Luckily for him and yourself, he just had to go to the studio, no flight out of state needed. Unfortunately, it was long hours for him, and your schedule wasn’t helping either. You both were back to texting and calling at random hours of the day. You had to scold yourself for being on your phone so much at work. It was hard to reprimand your intern if you were texting more than he was.

Chris had begged you to spend the night at his house the last two nights, but you were sticking to your guns.

“It’s only two more days Chris. We can make it. I didn’t see you for a full month and we survived that.” You said.

“Exactly. I haven’t seen you in a month!” 

You sighed. Even though you were the one not budging, it was hard on your too.

 “I know. You’re right. Can’t you come over for a little while though?” He asked.

“We both know I won’t end up leaving. Dodger will cuddle with me and I’ll fall asleep. It’s already after eleven.” You let out a laugh and you heard him slightly chuckle as well.

That night in the park where you had confessed your feelings for each other, he insisted on walking you home. Hand in hand. It was sweet and romantic with the sun setting in the distance. He walked you up the stairs to your door. Turning to face him, you leaned in for a kiss and then pulled back to say goodnight. Chris grabbed the back your head to hold you in place which caused you to start giggling. Once you started you couldn’t stop. He laid his head on your shoulder and joined you.

“This is how it’s going to be, isn’t it?” He asked. Smile evident in his voice.

“I’m pretty sure you know the answer to that by now. I hope this doesn’t charge your mind.”

He lifted his head and looked you in the eyes. He gave you a chaste kiss. “Absolutely.” Kiss “Not.” Kiss “I.” Kiss “Wouldn’t.” Kiss “Change.” Kiss “A thing.” Kiss

You circled your arms around his waist and caught your breath. He wrapped his arms around you and buried his head in your hair.

“Can we stay over tonight?” You pulled back to look at his face to get a read on if he was serious or not. “Or you can pack a bag and we can go to mine.” He said.

You let out a breath. “I don’t think that’s a good idea. We talked about doing this right. I think sleeping over without even having a date first is jumping ahead.”

He grabbed your hand in both of his and rubbed it gently. “I do want to do this right, but we’ve slept over at our places plenty of times.”

“Yes, but that was as friends.”

“We aren’t friends anymore?” Eyebrows raised with a serious expression on his face.

“Stop. You know that’s not true. You are my friend.” He pulled your hand to his lips and kissed it. “But I think we need to take a step back from the sleeping over thing. Just for a while.”

He nodded solemnly. “It’s going to be a long four days.”

You kissed each cheek and then kissed his lips long and slow. You rested your forehead on his and then kissed his nose before unlocking your door and saying goodnight.

The next night you were working late with Victoria in the office. You were coordinating a wedding that weekend and you were tasked with rearranging the seating chart as the bride had officially given up and the groom didn’t want to be involved. There had been a falling out between the bride’s mother and father. They had been divorced for a number of years but tensions had picked up due to the increasing budget. Mr. Schmitt and the former Mrs. Schmitt no longer agreed to be seated at the same table. Because the wedding was already so large, there was no room to add an additional table. You planned to come up with four optional changes to resolve the seating crisis and send it to the bride tomorrow. You had three, but couldn’t come up with the fourth. Your goal was to be home by nine, but it was already ten. Chris had been texting you, but you hadn’t been able to look or respond for the last hour.

A knocking at the door got your and Victoria’s attention. It’s an event coordinating office, you usually didn’t have visitors and it was well after delivery hours. You stood up and motioned for Victoria to join you as you both crept to the front of the office. The door is glass with no shade so you easily spotted Chris on the other side of the door.

“What’s Chris doing here?” Victoria asked.

Deciding to keep this new relationship between the two of you for a while, Victoria did not know about the kissing or the date tomorrow night.

You shrugged your shoulders as you walked to the door. Victoria staying by the reception desk. “He was texting me, but I haven’t had time to read them.”

You unlocked the door and opened it for him to enter. You subtly nodded your head back in Victoria’s direction so that he wouldn’t greet you with a kiss. He gave you a wink and raised his hand.

“Hi Victoria. Great to see you again.”

She walked toward the two of you and gave him a hug. Everyone’s a hugger in this town.

“I hope you don’t mind me borrowing Y/N for a minute.”

She giggled. “Of course not. I’ll just be in there.” Victoria pointed to the conference room in the back corner that you two were occupying and hurriedly walked away.

“What are you doing here? Not that I’m not happy to see you.” You leaned in for a kiss but he was hesitant. “Chris, babe, what’s wrong?” Babe? I sure like that word apparently.

“I’m sorry for just showing up here, but I really needed to talk to you.” You nodded and motioned to the overstuffed chairs near the door. You both took a seat as you felt your heart rate increase. Was he already having doubts? Did he want to cancel your date and thought it best to do in person. It had only been three days. What could happen in three days?

He grabbed your hand. At least this is comforting. “There’s a story that came out today.”

“Okay. What kind of story?”

“Someone took some pictures at that bachelor party I went to. There was this girl there.”

Oh boy. If your heart wasn’t already pumping as fast as it was, you were pretty sure it was setting a record.

You nodded asking that he continue. “Nothing happened. I just want to emphasize that.”

“Chris, we weren’t together then. I mean, we’re barely together now.” You were being honest. Yeah, it hurt you a bit that he hooked up with some random woman at the party, but he’s not yours to claim. You hadn’t even had the discussion about seeing each other until a couple days after that party.

“We’re going to come back to that comment about not being together now, but I want to explain myself first.” He said, eyebrows furrowed. “There were a few girls that sat in our section at the club. Some of the other guys let them up. This particular woman wanted a picture so she sat on my lap to take it. We took a couple of selfies together. She kissed my cheek in one. One of her friends or someone else took a picture of the two of us from a distance and in that picture it looks like her and I are kissing. A story came out today with the pictures saying her and I are an item. I don’t even know her name.” He took a breath. “It’s important to me that you believe me.”

You shake your head. Of course, you believed him. You didn’t think he would lie about something like this. “Chris, I believe you.” He looked surprised. He reached out and stroked your cheek. You couldn’t help but lean in. “Even if it were true, we hadn’t seen each other in a month, you’re allowed to be with other women.”

“But I was being honest with you when I said I wasn’t hooking up.” He moved his other hand to your face and held it with both hands. “Sweetheart, I didn’t want to be with anyone else. I hope this doesn’t make me sound like an asshole, but when you and Tim broke up, I held out hope that one day you’d forgive me and we could be together.”

You closed your eyes and shook your head. “Well aren’t you lucky that your wish came true.”

He stood up, giving you a hand to help you stand up. He pulled you close and hugged you around your waist. “I just wanted to tell you in person in case you saw something online.”  

You leaned in capturing his lips in a quick kiss before pulling back. “Thank you for telling me. I hate to kick you out, but I really need to wrap today up.”

He chuckled and pulled you back in for another hug. You walked him to the door and locked up, promising to see him tomorrow for your date. Now to come up with a lie to tell Victoria why he was there.

On your lunch break the next day, you pulled up Google and typed in Chris Evans. Without a doubt, you one hundred percent believed that he didn’t hook up with that woman, but you were curious. You’ve always loved movies, but you were never really the type to look up celebrities or buy celebrity magazines. Sure enough, under recent news were pictures of Chris and a young brunette. Big doe eyes and bright red lips. She was wearing a tight black dress that showed off her ample cleavage. She was beautiful. The headlines said things like New Love for Chris, New Couple Alert, Is She the One? You hadn’t even met her but you felt completely average by just looking at a picture of her on Chris’ lap. They looked like the typical Hollywood couple. You closed your laptop and dug into your left over pasta trying not to continue to compare yourself to other women.

After work, you went home to shower and change for your date with Chris. A date. Who would have ever thought that would happen between the two of you? It was hard not being able to share your excitement with anyone. You just really wanted to make sure things were really happening between the two of you before you brought your friends and family into the mix.

What if you crashed and burned? You barely kept your friendship, who’s to say dating would go any better? Ugh, you really needed to get rid of these negative thoughts.

You were dressed and ready to go with ten minutes to spare. Chris said to dress nicely, so you chose a cobalt blue wrap dress with three fourth length sleeves. You grabbed a black wrap since it was still chilly at night and you didn’t have a coat that would look nice with your dress.

At first you waited by the door for Chris. But that felt weird so you sat on your couch. Feet planted on the ground and hunched forward. Then you crossed your legs and leaned back trying to relax. Shoes! You should probably have your shoes on. You quickly walked to your closet and took out the new paid of black sling backs you purchased the other day. You really should have broken them in first, but you frankly had no time. Once the second shoe was in place, you heard a knock at your door. Grabbing your wrap and handbag, you opened the door to a very nicely dressed Chris. He had on a black suit with a white button-down sans tie and he looked good enough to eat.

“Y/N. You look…wow. You look beautiful.”

You lowered your head bashfully and smiled. “Thank you. You also look beautiful.” You laughed. “I mean, you look great.” He smiled and reached for your hand. It was like this was your first time meeting. Nerves were getting the best of you.

“Are you ready to go?” He asked. You nodded and followed him out the door.

The restaurant Chris chose was called n/naka. You weren’t sure how to pronounce it, but Chris had texted you the name so you could look it up to get an idea of the vibe. Apparently, it was one of those places that was extremely hard to get into. Chris had the car valet parked and helped you out of the car. He gave the host his name and she escorted you to the table with Chris’ hand on the small of your back the whole way.

The restaurant was beautiful with low lights and clean lines. The tables were a little close together for your liking, but you only had eyes for Chris anyway.

The server appeared at your table and informed you the menu was a prefix 13 course dinner. Your eyes widened and you instantly regretted the pasta lunch. Your server, Joseph, asked if you wanted to do the wine pairing. You looked to Chris who nodded at the server.

The wine arrived first. You weren’t a wine expert by any means, but it was red and delish.

Chris held up his glass and you followed suit. “To a lovely evening with a lovely lady. And to many more.” You clinked your glass to his and made sure to keep eye contact as you took a sip. Chris somehow managed to cough as he took his sip and promptly spilled the offending wine down the front of his white dress shirt. Your hands immediately covered your mouth as you scanned the restaurant for your server who apparently had seen the incident along with several other patrons. Chris started to laugh and you did as well. “I can’t believe I did that!”

Joseph appeared with a glass of club soda and an extra napkin. Chris immediately began to work on the stain, but it wasn’t coming out.

“It’s fine. Red’s a good color on you.” You said with a wink.

His cheeks became rosy and he gave a bashful smile.

The first three courses came out fast and were quickly eaten up. You were worried when Joseph said there would be thirteen, but each course wasn’t much more than a bite. Thinly sliced veggies and meats decorated like a piece of art on a plate. You tried desperately to keep an open mind and try each dish even when you didn’t know what it was. Several of the dishes were seafood which you generally liked, but you were more of a fish and chips or shrimp kind of girl. These dishes were seared tuna and pickled cod. You were trying every dish because Chris had gone to so much effort in planning the date. If this was his type of thing, you wanted to be able to enjoy it with him.

It was when the tenth dish came out that things took a turn for the worse. The beautifully plated dish had some sort of meat on it, but you weren’t sure what it was. Chris seemed to eat his piece with no problem, so you figured you could do the same. You pierced the small piece of meat and slid it through the sauce that decorated the plate. Bringing the fork to your mouth you took a tentative bite. The sauce had a good flavor, but the texture of the meat almost made you gag. With it still in your mouth, you inhaled through your nose slowly and went to chew again. But you couldn’t. The texture was too much and you gaged. Like gaged out loud that Chris and the table next to you heard. Your face instantly heated. Grabbing your napkin, you brought it to your mouth, trying to elegantly spit it into the napkin. Update, there is no real true way to elegantly do that, besides Chris was watching with concern.

You grabbed your glass of white and promptly drank it down. Once it was empty you looked to Chris. “I’m so sorry. I’m so embarrassed!” He reached for your hand and shook his head politely. “What was that?!”

Chris chuckled softly. “I think it was eel.” He shrugged as he said that.

“Well, it’s safe to say I don’t like eel.”

“I actually didn’t care for it either.”

You started to giggle which turned into full belly laughs when Chris joined in. The other patrons did not look amused, but it this point, neither of you cared.

“What are we doing here Chris? This so isn’t us.”

“It isn’t. I honestly have no idea what I was thinking.” You squeezed his hand and he did the same.

With the remaining courses you stuck to the vegetables on the plate if you could not identify the meat as one you liked.

Chris paid the bill and the two of you walked out, wine stain and all.            

“Are you still hungry by chance?” He asked.

You looked to him with bright eyes. “Oh my God yes!”

“Perfect.”

The two of you went through the drive thru at In-N-Out Burger and ate your food in the parking lot. When you finished your burger, you were completely stuffed.

Chris drove you home and walked you to your door. You were tempted to invite him in because you didn’t want the evening to end. However, you didn’t want the implication that you wanted things to go further tonight. After all, Chris is the one who said he wanted to woo you.

“Despite me gagging during dinner, I had a really good time with you tonight.”

“The first glass of wine dripping down my shirt didn’t ruin the evening?” He asked, a small smile on his lips.

“Nope. Not at all.” You said. Taking a step closer to him, you put your hands on the lapels of his jacket.

“Well, I’m glad to hear it. I hope I can see you again.” Speaking softer now, all joking forgotten.

“I’d really like that. In fact, I’d like to see you tomorrow if you can pencil me in.”

He brushed his lips against yours in a barely there kiss. “I think that sounds like a great idea. How about you come over in comfy clothes? I’ll order a pizza and will watch a movie.”

You brushed your lips against his and pulled back. You nodded your head and bit you lower lip. “Okay.”

“Okay?” He asked.

“Mmhmm.” Kiss “I like the sound of that.” Kiss

“It’s a date.”

“I don’t think I’ll ever get tired of hearing that.” You said.

“Then I’ll never stop saying this.”

Could he be any more perfect?

Chris pushed his fingers through your hair, gently embracing the back of your head and pulling you in for a kiss. It was more needy than the ones before. You parted your lips to grant him entrance which he greedily took. His tongue exploring your mouth which caused you to moan. He groaned in reply and you suddenly wished you had invited him in. His beard rubbed against your skin deliciously, but you were sure your face would be red when you said goodnight. 

It wasn’t until Chris pulled back to take a breath did you regain your composure. You leaned forward and kissed his nose.

“Goodnight.” You said.

“Goodnight.” 

You unlocked your door and hesitantly went inside, turning back to see Chris standing there with his hands in his pockets, a soft grin on his face.

After changing for bed and putting on HGTV to wind down, your phone dinged with a message from Chris.

Chris: Goodnight sweetheart 

Y/N: Goodnight babe

Description: When your husband dies in an accident, you try to move on with your life. When the memories of your shared home become too much even after two years, you make a drastic change and move to California. A new career, a new way of life, and an attractive new friend help you move on to find the happiness you need.

Pairings: Chris Evans x Reader    

Warnings for this chapter:  A smidge of angst. Mostly fluff! A little cursing. It’s me, you should expect that by now.

Chapter 17 pt 2

You had to wait four days before your first date with Chris. Four, long, torturous days. After your night in the park, he had to work the next two days on re-recording some audio for a movie he had filmed a few months back. Luckily for him and yourself, he just had to go to the studio, no flight out of state needed. Unfortunately, it was long hours for him, and your schedule wasn’t helping either. You both were back to texting and calling at random hours of the day. You had to scold yourself for being on your phone so much at work. It was hard to reprimand your intern if you were texting more than he was.

[[MORE]]

Chris had begged you to spend the night at his house the last two nights, but you were sticking to your guns.

“It’s only two more days Chris. We can make it. I didn’t see you for a full month and we survived that.” You said.

“Exactly. I haven’t seen you in a month!” 

You sighed. Even though you were the one not budging, it was hard on your too.

 “I know. You’re right. Can’t you come over for a little while though?” He asked.

“We both know I won’t end up leaving. Dodger will cuddle with me and I’ll fall asleep. It’s already after eleven.” You let out a laugh and you heard him slightly chuckle as well.

That night in the park where you had confessed your feelings for each other, he insisted on walking you home. Hand in hand. It was sweet and romantic with the sun setting in the distance. He walked you up the stairs to your door. Turning to face him, you leaned in for a kiss and then pulled back to say goodnight. Chris grabbed the back your head to hold you in place which caused you to start giggling. Once you started you couldn’t stop. He laid his head on your shoulder and joined you.

“This is how it’s going to be, isn’t it?” He asked. Smile evident in his voice.

“I’m pretty sure you know the answer to that by now. I hope this doesn’t charge your mind.”

He lifted his head and looked you in the eyes. He gave you a chaste kiss. “Absolutely.” Kiss “Not.” Kiss “I.” Kiss “Wouldn’t.” Kiss “Change.” Kiss “A thing.” Kiss

You circled your arms around his waist and caught your breath. He wrapped his arms around you and buried his head in your hair.

“Can we stay over tonight?” You pulled back to look at his face to get a read on if he was serious or not. “Or you can pack a bag and we can go to mine.” He said.

You let out a breath. “I don’t think that’s a good idea. We talked about doing this right. I think sleeping over without even having a date first is jumping ahead.”

He grabbed your hand in both of his and rubbed it gently. “I do want to do this right, but we’ve slept over at our places plenty of times.”

“Yes, but that was as friends.”

“We aren’t friends anymore?” Eyebrows raised with a serious expression on his face.

“Stop. You know that’s not true. You are my friend.” He pulled your hand to his lips and kissed it. “But I think we need to take a step back from the sleeping over thing. Just for a while.”

He nodded solemnly. “It’s going to be a long four days.”

You kissed each cheek and then kissed his lips long and slow. You rested your forehead on his and then kissed his nose before unlocking your door and saying goodnight.

The next night you were working late with Victoria in the office. You were coordinating a wedding that weekend and you were tasked with rearranging the seating chart as the bride had officially given up and the groom didn’t want to be involved. There had been a falling out between the bride’s mother and father. They had been divorced for a number of years but tensions had picked up due to the increasing budget. Mr. Schmitt and the former Mrs. Schmitt no longer agreed to be seated at the same table. Because the wedding was already so large, there was no room to add an additional table. You planned to come up with four optional changes to resolve the seating crisis and send it to the bride tomorrow. You had three, but couldn’t come up with the fourth. Your goal was to be home by nine, but it was already ten. Chris had been texting you, but you hadn’t been able to look or respond for the last hour.

A knocking at the door got your and Victoria’s attention. It’s an event coordinating office, you usually didn’t have visitors and it was well after delivery hours. You stood up and motioned for Victoria to join you as you both crept to the front of the office. The door is glass with no shade so you easily spotted Chris on the other side of the door.

“What’s Chris doing here?” Victoria asked.

Deciding to keep this new relationship between the two of you for a while, Victoria did not know about the kissing or the date tomorrow night.

You shrugged your shoulders as you walked to the door. Victoria staying by the reception desk. “He was texting me, but I haven’t had time to read them.”

You unlocked the door and opened it for him to enter. You subtly nodded your head back in Victoria’s direction so that he wouldn’t greet you with a kiss. He gave you a wink and raised his hand.

“Hi Victoria. Great to see you again.”

She walked toward the two of you and gave him a hug. Everyone’s a hugger in this town.

“I hope you don’t mind me borrowing Y/N for a minute.”

She giggled. “Of course not. I’ll just be in there.” Victoria pointed to the conference room in the back corner that you two were occupying and hurriedly walked away.

“What are you doing here? Not that I’m not happy to see you.” You leaned in for a kiss but he was hesitant. “Chris, babe, what’s wrong?” Babe? I sure like that word apparently.

“I’m sorry for just showing up here, but I really needed to talk to you.” You nodded and motioned to the overstuffed chairs near the door. You both took a seat as you felt your heart rate increase. Was he already having doubts? Did he want to cancel your date and thought it best to do in person. It had only been three days. What could happen in three days?

He grabbed your hand. At least this is comforting. “There’s a story that came out today.”

“Okay. What kind of story?”

“Someone took some pictures at that bachelor party I went to. There was this girl there.”

Oh boy. If your heart wasn’t already pumping as fast as it was, you were pretty sure it was setting a record.

You nodded asking that he continue. “Nothing happened. I just want to emphasize that.”

“Chris, we weren’t together then. I mean, we’re barely together now.” You were being honest. Yeah, it hurt you a bit that he hooked up with some random woman at the party, but he’s not yours to claim. You hadn’t even had the discussion about seeing each other until a couple days after that party.

“We’re going to come back to that comment about not being together now, but I want to explain myself first.” He said, eyebrows furrowed. “There were a few girls that sat in our section at the club. Some of the other guys let them up. This particular woman wanted a picture so she sat on my lap to take it. We took a couple of selfies together. She kissed my cheek in one. One of her friends or someone else took a picture of the two of us from a distance and in that picture it looks like her and I are kissing. A story came out today with the pictures saying her and I are an item. I don’t even know her name.” He took a breath. “It’s important to me that you believe me.”

You shake your head. Of course, you believed him. You didn’t think he would lie about something like this. “Chris, I believe you.” He looked surprised. He reached out and stroked your cheek. You couldn’t help but lean in. “Even if it were true, we hadn’t seen each other in a month, you’re allowed to be with other women.”

“But I was being honest with you when I said I wasn’t hooking up.” He moved his other hand to your face and held it with both hands. “Sweetheart, I didn’t want to be with anyone else. I hope this doesn’t make me sound like an asshole, but when you and Tim broke up, I held out hope that one day you’d forgive me and we could be together.”

You closed your eyes and shook your head. “Well aren’t you lucky that your wish came true.”

He stood up, giving you a hand to help you stand up. He pulled you close and hugged you around your waist. “I just wanted to tell you in person in case you saw something online.”  

You leaned in capturing his lips in a quick kiss before pulling back. “Thank you for telling me. I hate to kick you out, but I really need to wrap today up.”

He chuckled and pulled you back in for another hug. You walked him to the door and locked up, promising to see him tomorrow for your date. Now to come up with a lie to tell Victoria why he was there.

On your lunch break the next day, you pulled up Google and typed in Chris Evans. Without a doubt, you one hundred percent believed that he didn’t hook up with that woman, but you were curious. You’ve always loved movies, but you were never really the type to look up celebrities or buy celebrity magazines. Sure enough, under recent news were pictures of Chris and a young brunette. Big doe eyes and bright red lips. She was wearing a tight black dress that showed off her ample cleavage. She was beautiful. The headlines said things like New Love for Chris, New Couple Alert, Is She the One? You hadn’t even met her but you felt completely average by just looking at a picture of her on Chris’ lap. They looked like the typical Hollywood couple. You closed your laptop and dug into your left over pasta trying not to continue to compare yourself to other women.

After work, you went home to shower and change for your date with Chris. A date. Who would have ever thought that would happen between the two of you? It was hard not being able to share your excitement with anyone. You just really wanted to make sure things were really happening between the two of you before you brought your friends and family into the mix.

What if you crashed and burned? You barely kept your friendship, who’s to say dating would go any better? Ugh, you really needed to get rid of these negative thoughts.

You were dressed and ready to go with ten minutes to spare. Chris said to dress nicely, so you chose a cobalt blue wrap dress with three fourth length sleeves. You grabbed a black wrap since it was still chilly at night and you didn’t have a coat that would look nice with your dress.

At first you waited by the door for Chris. But that felt weird so you sat on your couch. Feet planted on the ground and hunched forward. Then you crossed your legs and leaned back trying to relax. Shoes! You should probably have your shoes on. You quickly walked to your closet and took out the new paid of black sling backs you purchased the other day. You really should have broken them in first, but you frankly had no time. Once the second shoe was in place, you heard a knock at your door. Grabbing your wrap and handbag, you opened the door to a very nicely dressed Chris. He had on a black suit with a white button-down sans tie and he looked good enough to eat.

“Y/N. You look…wow. You look beautiful.”

You lowered your head bashfully and smiled. “Thank you. You also look beautiful.” You laughed. “I mean, you look great.” He smiled and reached for your hand. It was like this was your first time meeting. Nerves were getting the best of you.

“Are you ready to go?” He asked. You nodded and followed him out the door.

The restaurant Chris chose was called n/naka. You weren’t sure how to pronounce it, but Chris had texted you the name so you could look it up to get an idea of the vibe. Apparently, it was one of those places that was extremely hard to get into. Chris had the car valet parked and helped you out of the car. He gave the host his name and she escorted you to the table with Chris’ hand on the small of your back the whole way.

The restaurant was beautiful with low lights and clean lines. The tables were a little close together for your liking, but you only had eyes for Chris anyway.

The server appeared at your table and informed you the menu was a prefix 13 course dinner. Your eyes widened and you instantly regretted the pasta lunch. Your server, Joseph, asked if you wanted to do the wine pairing. You looked to Chris who nodded at the server.

The wine arrived first. You weren’t a wine expert by any means, but it was red and delish.

Chris held up his glass and you followed suit. “To a lovely evening with a lovely lady. And to many more.” You clinked your glass to his and made sure to keep eye contact as you took a sip. Chris somehow managed to cough as he took his sip and promptly spilled the offending wine down the front of his white dress shirt. Your hands immediately covered your mouth as you scanned the restaurant for your server who apparently had seen the incident along with several other patrons. Chris started to laugh and you did as well. “I can’t believe I did that!”

Joseph appeared with a glass of club soda and an extra napkin. Chris immediately began to work on the stain, but it wasn’t coming out.

“It’s fine. Red’s a good color on you.” You said with a wink.

His cheeks became rosy and he gave a bashful smile.

The first three courses came out fast and were quickly eaten up. You were worried when Joseph said there would be thirteen, but each course wasn’t much more than a bite. Thinly sliced veggies and meats decorated like a piece of art on a plate. You tried desperately to keep an open mind and try each dish even when you didn’t know what it was. Several of the dishes were seafood which you generally liked, but you were more of a fish and chips or shrimp kind of girl. These dishes were seared tuna and pickled cod. You were trying every dish because Chris had gone to so much effort in planning the date. If this was his type of thing, you wanted to be able to enjoy it with him.

It was when the tenth dish came out that things took a turn for the worse. The beautifully plated dish had some sort of meat on it, but you weren’t sure what it was. Chris chuckled softly. “I think it was eel.” He shrugged as he said that.

“Well, it’s safe to say I don’t like eel.”

“I actually didn’t care for it either.”

“It isn’t. I honestly have no idea what I was thinking.” You squeezed his hand and he did the same.

With the remaining courses you stuck to the vegetables on the plate if you could not identify the meat as one you liked.

Chris paid the bill and the two of you walked out, wine stain and all.            

“Are you still hungry by chance?” He asked.

You looked to him with bright eyes. “Oh my God yes!”

“Perfect.”

The two of you went through the drive thru at In-N-Out Burger and ate your food in the parking lot. When you finished your burger, you were completely stuffed.

Chris drove you home and walked you to your door. You were tempted to invite him in because you didn’t want the evening to end. However, you didn’t want the implication that you wanted things to go further tonight. After all, Chris is the one who said he wanted to woo you.

“Despite me gagging during dinner, I had a really good time with you tonight.”

“The first glass of wine dripping down my shirt didn’t ruin the evening?” He asked, a small smile on his lips.

“Nope. Not at all.” You said. Taking a step closer to him, you put your hands on the lapels of his jacket.

“Well, I’m glad to hear it. I hope I can see you again.” Speaking softer now, all joking forgotten.

“I’d really like that. In fact, I’d like to see you tomorrow if you can pencil me in.”

He brushed his lips against yours in a barely there kiss. “I think that sounds like a great idea. How about you come over in comfy clothes? I’ll order a pizza and will watch a movie.”

You brushed your lips against his and pulled back. You nodded your head and bit you lower lip. “Okay.”

“Okay?” He asked.

“Mmhmm.” Kiss “I like the sound of that.” Kiss

“It’s a date.”

“I don’t think I’ll ever get tired of hearing that.” You said.

“Then I’ll never stop saying this.”

Could he be any more perfect?

Chris pushed his fingers through your hair, gently embracing the back of your head and pulling you in for a kiss. It was more needy than the ones before. You parted your lips to grant him entrance which he greedily took. His tongue exploring your mouth which caused you to moan. He groaned in reply and you suddenly wished you had invited him in. His beard rubbed against your skin deliciously, but you were sure your face would be red when you said goodnight. 

It wasn’t until Chris pulled back to take a breath did you regain your composure. You leaned forward and kissed his nose.

“Goodnight.” You said.

“Goodnight.” 

You unlocked your door and hesitantly went inside, turning back to see Chris standing there with his hands in his pockets, a soft grin on his face.

After changing for bed and putting on HGTV to wind down, your phone dinged with a message from Chris.

Chris: Goodnight sweetheart

“I’m sorry for just showing up here, but I really needed to talk to you.” You nodded and motioned to the overstuffed chairs near the door. You both took a seat as you felt your heart rate increase. Was he already having doubts? Did he want to cancel your date and thought it best to do in person. It had only been three days. What could happen in three days?

He grabbed your hand. At least this is comforting. “There’s a story that came out today.”

“Okay. What kind of story?”

“Someone took some pictures at that bachelor party I went to. There was this girl there.”

Oh boy. If your heart wasn’t already pumping as fast as it was, you were pretty sure it was setting a record.

You nodded asking that he continue. “Nothing happened. I just want to emphasize that.”

“Chris, we weren’t together then. I mean, we’re barely together now.” You were being honest. Yeah, it hurt you a bit that he hooked up with some random woman at the party, but he’s not yours to claim. You hadn’t even had the discussion about seeing each other until a couple days after that party.

Some of the other guys let them up. This particular woman wanted a picture so she sat on my lap to take it. We took a couple of selfies together. She kissed my cheek in one. One of her friends or someone else took a picture of the two of us from a distance and in that picture it looks like her and I are kissing. A story came out today with the pictures saying her and I are an item. I don’t even know her name.” He took a breath. “It’s important to me that you believe me.”

You shake your head. Of course, you believed him. You didn’t think he would lie about something like this. “Chris, I believe you.” He looked surprised. He reached out and stroked your cheek. You couldn’t help but lean in. “Even if it were true, we hadn’t seen each other in a month, you’re allowed to be with other women.”

“But I was being honest with you when I said I wasn’t hooking up.” He moved his other hand to your face and held it with both hands. “Sweetheart, I didn’t want to be with anyone else. I hope this doesn’t make me sound like an asshole, but when you and Tim broke up, I held out hope that one day you’d forgive me and we could be together.”

You closed your eyes and shook your head. “Well aren’t you lucky that your wish came true.”

He stood up, giving you a hand to help you stand up. He pulled you close and hugged you around your waist. “I just wanted to tell you in person in case you saw something online.”  

You leaned in capturing his lips in a quick kiss before pulling back. “Thank you for telling me. I hate to kick you out, but I really need to wrap today up.”

He chuckled and pulled you back in for another hug. You walked him to the door and locked up, promising to see him tomorrow for your date. Now to come up with a lie to tell Victoria why he was there.

You’ve always loved movies, but you were never really the type to look up celebrities or buy celebrity magazines. Sure enough, under recent news were pictures of Chris and a young brunette. Big doe eyes and bright red lips. She was wearing a tight black dress that showed off her ample cleavage. She was beautiful. The headlines said things like New Love for Chris, New Couple Alert, Is She the One? You hadn’t even met her but you felt completely average by just looking at a picture of her on Chris’ lap. They looked like the typical Hollywood couple. You closed your laptop and dug into your left over pasta trying not to continue to compare yourself to other women.

It was hard not being able to share your excitement with anyone. You just really wanted to make sure things were really happening between the two of you before you brought your friends and family into the mix.

What if you crashed and burned? You barely kept your friendship, who’s to say dating would go any better? Ugh, you really needed to get rid of these negative thoughts.

At first you waited by the door for Chris. But that felt weird so you sat on your couch. Feet planted on the ground and hunched forward. Then you crossed your legs and leaned back trying to relax. Shoes! You should probably have your shoes on. You quickly walked to your closet and took out the new paid of black sling backs you purchased the other day. You really should have broken them in first, but you frankly had no time. Once the second shoe was in place, you heard a knock at your door. Grabbing your wrap and handbag, you opened the door to a very nicely dressed Chris. He had on a black suit with a white button-down sans tie and he looked good enough to eat.

“Y/N. You look…wow. You look beautiful.”

You lowered your head bashfully and smiled. “Thank you. You also look beautiful.” You laughed. “I mean, you look great.” He smiled and reached for your hand. It was like this was your first time meeting. Nerves were getting the best of you.

“Are you ready to go?” He asked. You nodded and followed him out the door.

Apparently, it was one of those places that was extremely hard to get into. Chris had the car valet parked and helped you out of the car. He gave the host his name and she escorted you to the table with Chris’ hand on the small of your back the whole way.

The restaurant was beautiful with low lights and clean lines. The tables were a little close together for your liking, but you only had eyes for Chris anyway.

The server appeared at your table and informed you the menu was a prefix 13 course dinner. Your eyes widened and you instantly regretted the pasta lunch. Your server, Joseph, asked if you wanted to do the wine pairing. You looked to Chris who nodded at the server.

The wine arrived first. You weren’t a wine expert by any means, but it was red and delish.

Chris held up his glass and you followed suit. “To a lovely evening with a lovely lady. And to many more.” You clinked your glass to his and made sure to keep eye contact as you took a sip. Chris somehow managed to cough as he took his sip and promptly spilled the offending wine down the front of his white dress shirt. Your hands immediately covered your mouth as you scanned the restaurant for your server who apparently had seen the incident along with several other patrons. Chris started to laugh and you did as well. “I can’t believe I did that!”

Joseph appeared with a glass of club soda and an extra napkin. Chris immediately began to work on the stain, but it wasn’t coming out.

“It’s fine. Red’s a good color on you.” You said with a wink.

His cheeks became rosy and he gave a bashful smile.

Thinly sliced veggies and meats decorated like a piece of art on a plate. You tried desperately to keep an open mind and try each dish even when you didn’t know what it was. Several of the dishes were seafood which you generally liked, but you were more of a fish and chips or shrimp kind of girl. These dishes were seared tuna and pickled cod. You were trying every dish because Chris had gone to so much effort in planning the date. If this was his type of thing, you wanted to be able to enjoy it with him.

Update, there is no real true way to elegantly do that, besides Chris was watching with concern.

You looked to him with bright eyes. “Oh my God yes!”

“Perfect.”

“Despite me gagging during dinner, I had a really good time with you tonight.”

“The first glass of wine dripping down my shirt didn’t ruin the evening?” He asked, a small smile on his lips.

“I’d really like that. In fact, I’d like to see you tomorrow if you can pencil me in.”

You brushed your lips against his and pulled back. You nodded your head and bit you lower lip. “Okay.”

“Okay?” He asked.

“Mmhmm.” Kiss “I like the sound of that.” Kiss

“It’s a date.”

“I don’t think I’ll ever get tired of hearing that.” You said.

“Then I’ll never stop saying this.”

Could he be any more perfect?

His beard rubbed against your skin deliciously, but you were sure your face would be red when you said goodnight. 

It wasn’t until Chris pulled back to take a breath did you regain your composure. You leaned forward and kissed his nose.

“Goodnight.” You said.

“Goodnight.” 

You unlocked your door and hesitantly went inside, turning back to see Chris standing there with his hands in his pockets, a soft grin on his face.

After changing for bed and putting on HGTV to wind down, your phone dinged with a message from Chris.

Chris: Goodnight sweetheart 

Y/N: Goodnight babe

Chapter 18

Description: When your husband dies in an accident, you try to move on with your life. When the memories of your shared home become too much even after two years, you make a drastic change and move to California. A new career, a new way of life, and an attractive new friend help you move on to find the happiness you need.

Pairings: Chris Evans x Reader    

Warnings for this chapter:  A smidge of angst. Mostly fluff! A little cursing. It’s me, you should expect that by now.

A/N: THANK YOU guys so much for your love and support on this series. This originally started out as a one shot but I loved writing that it just kept going. After this chapter there are only two chapters left! Don’t forget to vote on which story you want next! Please let me know if you would like to be tagged and keep let me know what you think! Reblogs are always appreciated.

trail.content_abstract:
Chapter 18

Description: When your husband dies in an accident, you try to move on with your life. When the memories of your shared home become too much even after two years, you make a drastic change and move to California. A new career, a new way of life, and an attractive new friend help you move on to find the happiness you need.

Pairings: Chris Evans x Reader    

Warnings for this chapter:  A smidge of angst. Mostly fluff! A little cursing. It’s me, you should expect that by now.

A/N: THANK YOU guys so much for your love and support on this series. This originally started out as a one shot but I loved writing that it just kept going. After this chapter there are only two chapters left! Don’t forget to vote on which story you want next! Please let me know if you would like to be tagged and keep let me know what you think! Reblogs are always appreciated.

Chapter 17 pt 2

You had to wait four days before your first date with Chris. Four, long, torturous days. After your night in the park, he had to work the next two days on re-recording some audio for a movie he had filmed a few months back. Luckily for him and yourself, he just had to go to the studio, no flight out of state needed. Unfortunately, it was long hours for him, and your schedule wasn’t helping either. You both were back to texting and calling at random hours of the day. You had to scold yourself for being on your phone so much at work. It was hard to reprimand your intern if you were texting more than he was.
